Name: Head of Ptolemy the Fourth (Philopator)
Description: The colossal head of Ptolemy the Fourth, carved following the Egyptian style, shows the king as a pharaoh. His hair is wavy and his hair locks are in two rows falling on his forehead and the sides of his face. They reach his beard. He is shown wearing the Double Crown of Egypt with the sacred cobra. It has a dorsal, or back, column; the head is square; the eyes were inlaid. The uppermost part of the crown, the cobra and the nose are broken.
